verses.name: 1 Corinthians 16:1
verses.text: Now concerning the collection for the saints, as I have given order to the churches of Galatia, even so do ye.

verses.name: 1 Corinthians 16:2
verses.text: Upon the first day of the week let every one of you lay by him in store, as God hath prospered him, that there be no gatherings when I come.

verses.name: 1 Corinthians 16:3
verses.text: And when I come, whomsoever ye shall approve by your letters, them will I send to bring your liberality unto Jerusalem.

verses.name: 1 Corinthians 16:4
verses.text: And if it be meet that I go also, they shall go with me.

verses.name: 1 Corinthians 16:5
verses.text: Now I will come unto you, when I shall pass through Macedonia: for I do pass through Macedonia.

verses.name: 1 Corinthians 16:6
verses.text: And it may be that I will abide, yea, and winter with you, that ye may bring me on my journey whithersoever I go.

verses.name: 1 Corinthians 16:7
verses.text: For I will not see you now by the way; but I trust to tarry a while with you, if the Lord permit.

verses.name: 1 Corinthians 16:8
verses.text: But I will tarry at Ephesus until Pentecost.

verses.name: 1 Corinthians 16:9
verses.text: For a great door and effectual is opened unto me, and there are many adversaries.

verses.name: 1 Corinthians 16:10
verses.text: Now if Timotheus come, see that he may be with you without fear: for he worketh the work of the Lord, as I also do.

verses.name: 1 Corinthians 16:11
verses.text: Let no man therefore despise him: but conduct him forth in peace, that he may come unto me: for I look for him with the brethren.

verses.name: 1 Corinthians 16:12
verses.text: As touching our brother Apollos, I greatly desired him to come unto you with the brethren: but his will was not at all to come at this time; but he will come when he shall have convenient time.

verses.name: 1 Corinthians 16:13
verses.text: Watch ye, stand fast in the faith, quit you like men, be strong.

verses.name: 1 Corinthians 16:14
verses.text: Let all your things be done with charity.

verses.name: 1 Corinthians 16:15
verses.text: I beseech you, brethren, (ye know the house of Stephanas, that it is the firstfruits of Achaia, and that they have addicted themselves to the ministry of the saints,)

verses.name: 1 Corinthians 16:16
verses.text: That ye submit yourselves unto such, and to every one that helpeth with us, and laboureth.

verses.name: 1 Corinthians 16:17
verses.text: I am glad of the coming of Stephanas and Fortunatus and Achaicus: for that which was lacking on your part they have supplied.

verses.name: 1 Corinthians 16:18
verses.text: For they have refreshed my spirit and yours: therefore acknowledge ye them that are such.

verses.name: 1 Corinthians 16:19
verses.text: The churches of Asia salute you. Aquila and Priscilla salute you much in the Lord, with the church that is in their house.

verses.name: 1 Corinthians 16:20
verses.text: All the brethren greet you. Greet ye one another with an holy kiss.

verses.name: 1 Corinthians 16:21
verses.text: The salutation of me Paul with mine own hand.

verses.name: 1 Corinthians 16:22
verses.text: If any man love not the Lord Jesus Christ, let him be Anathema Maranatha.

verses.name: 1 Corinthians 16:23
verses.text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you.

verses.name: 1 Corinthians 16:24
verses.text: My love be with you all in Christ Jesus. Amen.  The first epistle to the Corinthians was written from Philippi by Stephanas, and Fortunatus, and Achaicus, and Timotheus.
